intro: Tithymalus tianshanicus, commonly known as the Tianshan tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to the Tianshan mountain range in Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and cool climates. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
